page.title: 03FARMING IN PULBOROUGH
page.content: Pulborough is surrounded by farms,some with grazing for animals,some growing cereals,vegtables or crops.A farmer grows barley, wheat,oil-seed rape,peas and potatoes.Most land is good for growing crops,but some parts are very sandy and dry.Each field has a different crop every year in a 4 course rotation (except grass fields). The busiest time of year is between May and September.An acre can graze 1 cow or 5 sheep and their lambs,or 8 sheep.They eat hay,cocentrates and silage in the winter.He has 150 cows and 300 sheep plus their lambs.A cow will live about 10 years and a sheep 8 years.Calves and orphan lambs are fed by hand.The cows stay out in the summer but winter inside.Sheep stay out summer and winter,but come in to lamb.
